dialogues.text: It's morphine. It'll make it hurt less, so you can get some rest. Nod your head if you want it. (Valentine nods) Okay, count to forty. Listen, don't tell about this or I'll lose my job. God, the way they worked you over, it's barbaric. (finishes) There. It'll ease the pain in just a minute and you'll be able to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF VALENTIN
dialogues.text: Twenty-nine, thirty, thirty-one, thirty-uh... thirty... Valentin smiles slightly. His arm, folded to hold the cotton-ball, slumps down. His hand is clasped by a woman's hand.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF MARTA
dialogues.text: Valentin, don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF VALENTIN
dialogues.text: Marta. Her hand tugs his toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prison corridor, like a long tunnel, is strangely dark with a door of glowing light at the end. The shadowy nude silhouettes of Valentin and Marta move toward the light.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF MARTA
dialogues.text: Come, Valentin, come with me. Don't be afraid. You won't wake up in a cell.  Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org The light is filtered through dense jungle plants. leads him out the door into the foliage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their silhouettes push through the shadowy leaves. 115. Marta

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: It is the same jungle that was in Molina's movie about the Spider Woman.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF MARTA
dialogues.text: Hurry, Valentin. They won't find you here.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF VALENTIN
dialogues.text: But Molina is dead.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF MARTA
dialogues.text: Don't be sad, my love. Only he knows if he died sad or happy. Still holding hands, they emerge from the jungle and see the beautiful sun-lit beach with the water-logged rowboat Their silhouettes run across the beach into the ocean. They embrace in the water.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF VALENTIN
dialogues.text: Don't leave me.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF MARTA
dialogues.text: Nothing can separate us now.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF VALENTIN
dialogues.text: Oh how much I love you. That's the one thing I've never said, because I'm so afraid of losing your love forever.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OF MARTA
dialogues.text: That will never happen here. This dream is short, but this dream is happy. They kiss again, then gaze at the sparkling horizon.
